thread.title: Oscars 2017 host Jimmy Kimmel pokes fun at Donald Trump in opening speech as he reignites feud with Matt Damon
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017 host Jimmy Kimmel pokes fun at Donald Trump in opening speech as he reignites feud with Matt Damon

title: Oscars 2017 host Jimmy Kimmel pokes fun at Donald Trump in opening speech as he reignites feud with Matt Damon
text:
TV Magazine TRUMPED BY KIMMEL Oscars 2017 host Jimmy Kimmel pokes fun at Donald Trump in opening speech as he reignites feud with Matt Damon 
The comedian did not hold back as he ripped into Hollywood's elite and praised Meryl Streep BY NOLA OJOMU, SHOWBIZ REPORTER 27th February 2017, 2:28 am VIEWERS flocked to Twitter to share their praise for comedian Jimmy Kimmel as he successfully hosted the 89th Academy Awards on Sunday evening. 
All famous names were all target of the funnyman on the night as he mocked the nominees and recent news events as he kicked off the biggest night in the award season calendar. 2 
Jimmy, 49, admitted he knew the country was divided and he had been encouraged to say something that would unite people before thanking President Donald Trump for making the Oscars appear less racist. 
Opening the show he said the ceremony was being watched around the world by ‚Äúcountries that now hate us‚Äù adding: ‚ÄúThe country is divided right now, I‚Äôve been been getting advice that I need to say something to unite us. 
‚ÄúLet me say something. I can‚Äôt do that. There is only one Braveheart in this room and he‚Äôs not going to do that either.‚Äù 
He added: ‚ÄúI want to say thank you to President Trump. Remember last year when it seemed like the Oscars were racist? It‚Äôs gone!‚Äù All famous names were all target of the funnyman on the night as he mocked the nominees and recent news events as he kicked off the biggest night in the award season calendar Jimmy Kimmel pokes fun at Donald Trump banning 'fake news' media outlets from the Oscars 
Jimmy also continued his "feud" with Matt Damon after he tweeted a picture of Damon at the ceremony with the caption: "Dead man walking the red carpet." 
The pair have had a long-standing feud that dates back many years and was sparked when Kimmel started signing off his popular American talk show saying: "Apologies to Matt Damon, we ran out of time." 
Asked if he thought Kimmel was going to take aim at him during the ceremony, Damon told E! News: "It's going to probably be ugly." Can we all agree @jimmykimmel is doing an amazing hosting job of the #oscars ?? So far on par like Ellen!! Good job JimmyüòÉ #jimmykimmel 
‚Äî Inez Cosmos (@Inez2you) February 27, 2017 So far Jimmy Kimmel is doing well. Very funny. I'm flashing back to him on Comedy Central. Way to sustain your weight loss man. üëäüèº 
‚Äî Cassandra Pate (@cdpate) February 27, 2017 Best host yet? #jimmykimmel is killin' it!! @jimmykimmel 
‚Äî Tara Marie Rose (@TaraMarieRose_) February 27, 2017 
He then jokingly added that despite "couples therapy", the pair hadn't sorted things out, saying: "Maybe tonight is our night." 
Comedian Sarah Silverman, who used to date Kimmel, made a video with Damon in 2008 as a joke, during which she told Kimmel the pair were having an affair. 
Kimmel followed it up by teaming up with Damon's best friend, actor Ben Affleck, to produce a video of their own. 
Viewers began tweeting after Jimmy fired his first jokes with one tweeting: "Best host yet? #jimmykimmel is killin' it!!" Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel 'buries the hatchet' with Matt Damon 
Another wrote: "So far Jimmy Kimmel is doing well. Very funny. I'm flashing back to him on Comedy Central. Way to sustain your weight loss man." 
While one fan agreed: "Can we all agree @jimmykimmel is doing an amazing hosting job of the #oscars ?? So far on par like Ellen!! Good job Jimmy #jimmykimmel"
